oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The B-17, continued

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Poetry; Barbed wire; Bombers
World War, 1939-1945 -- Europe; Prisoners of war; Diaries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This page in Mitchener's POW diary from World War II shows the continuation of a poem called "The B-17," by POW D. Hughes. The poem is about the greatness of the B-17 bomber. A drawing of a B-17 bomber with the word,"Glory!" above it can also be seen.

Hardy A. Mitchener, Jr. was taken prisoner during World War II after a bombing mission in Germany. He served as a second lieutenant in the 509th Bombardment Squadron, 351st Bombardment Group, 8th Air Force. His B-17G had bombed the aircraft plant in Oschersleben and was headed back to England when it was shot down by FW-190 fighters on May 30, 1944. One of his crewmates, Lester L. Kunz, died in the crash. Mitchener was listed as the crew's navigator.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mitchener, Hardy A., 1919-1957
